messages.message: Hey @Mohit. I’m looking again this morning, and its actually preview thats giving me the issue. For some reason when I open the .ipynb file it opens in preview by default. So its not Jupyter thats causing the issue.
@Lee, you can directly open a ipynb file in jupyter by right clicking on it and selecting open with jupyter…

Thanks @Naveen. If it has that file type, can it open in jupyter automatically? I didn’t notice it didn’t open in that, and because of the large size of the document, it was causing issues with preview.
Its used to work that way, @Jessica (i think) changed it to preview. Yes, we should change the default to jupyter. Anant suggested that as well.
Hey, I actually made this change once and Anant had me change it back - see all the messages here for context: https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C06FA6A23/p1602653007104300
oops, thanks for sharing the context.
In that case, @Lee can you share the screenshot of issues you see in the preview. Thanks
